info.title: Integration Content
info.description:
Integration content enables you to read, update, deploy, or undeploy integration artifacts (such as integration flows) on a tenant. 
This API is implemented based on OData version 2 specification. 
 If you like to request the OData API on your tenant, you need to know how to find out the address of the HTTP call. For more information, see [HTTP Calls and URL Components](https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_INTEGRATION_SUITE/51ab953548be4459bfe8539ecaeee98d/ca75e12fc5904d96a038aef6c00db5fc.html).
 If you face problems using the API, you can create a ticket. Check out for the right support component on this page: [Support Components](https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_INTEGRATION_SUITE/51ab953548be4459bfe8539ecaeee98d/bd2d883ae8ee4e2696038be7741d93d7.html).

post.description:
You can use the following request to copy an integration package from 'Discover' to 'Design' section. If the package already exists, either the existing package can be overwritten or a new package with a suffix for name and Id can be created.
For further details, refer to the SAP Help Portal documentation [OData API: Integration Content](https://help.sap.com/viewer/368c481cd6954bdfa5d0435479fd4eaf/Cloud/en-US/d1679a80543f46509a7329243b595bdb.html) and to the following SAP Community blog [Remote OData APIs for Integration Flows](https://blogs.sap.com/2018/07/06/cloud-integration-remote-odata-apis-for-integration-flows/).
In API sandbox, only read APIs can be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to create an integration package.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description:
Id of integration package - enclosed in single quotes
Example: ```'ERPtoSuccessFactorsEmployeeCentralEmployeeandOrganizationalData'```.
The Id can be found in the package URL.

parameters.name: ImportMode
parameters.description:
If the package already exists, it can be overwritten by the copied package, or a new package could be created with a new suffix, which needs to be provided by query parameter 'Suffix'.
OVERWRITE_MERGE - With this mode, the package will be copied and overwritten to an existing/already copied package from Discover, would keep the configurations (of externalized parameters) intact for the existing/already copied package's artifacts.

parameters.name: Suffix
parameters.description:
Suffix is required, if a package with the same name already exists and an additional copy of the same package should be created. The entered value must be enclosed in single quotes.
Example: Entered Suffix ```'ABC'``` creates a new package, where ```.ABC``` is added to the name and to the artifacts Ids.
Note: Only relevant for query parameter 'ImportMode' ```'CREATE_COPY'```.
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling')
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

d.Name: ERP to SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central Employee and Organizational Data
d.Description: <p><p><p><p><p><p><p>This integration package enables you to replicate employee master and organizational management data from&nbsp;SAP ERP or SAP S/4HANA&nbsp;to SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central. With this integration scenario you can manage employees and organizational data using ERP as the system of record and either regularly replicate the data to Employee Central when using the Side-by-Side deployment model. Or set up a delta-enabled migration to initially move the data from the ERP system to Employee Central if you want to transition to the Side-by-Side or the Core Hybrid deployment model.</p><p>Prerequisite for using this integration scenario: You need to have the PA_SE_IN 100 add-on with SP10 or higher installed in your SAP ERP or SAP S/4HANA system.</p><p>Note: You are only allowed to configure the content as described in the guide. If you make modifications not described in the guide, SAP will not provide support for the modified content.</p></p></p></p></p></p></p>
d.ShortText: Replicate employee master and organizational management data from SAP ERP or SAP S/4HANA to SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central

400.description: Bad Request - because of unexpected Id value (e.g. Id provided without single quotes).

message.value: Unknown literal: '[ERPtoSuccessFactorsEmployeeCentralEmployeeandOrganizationalData]'.

409.description: Conflict - because the package with the same name/Id already exists. In order to create a copy, add 'ImportMode' as ```'CREATE_COPY'``` and 'Suffix' with a new value or to overwrite existing content, specify 'ImportMode' as ```'OVERWRITE'```.

message.value: Copy not successful from content hub to workpace due to conflict.In order to create an copy, add 'ImportMode' as 'CREATE_COPY' and 'Suffix' with desired value in url as parameter,Or to Overwrite existing content, specify 'ImportMode' as 'OVERWRITE' in url as parameter.

results.Name: ERP to SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central Employee and Organizational Data
results.Description:
This integration package enables you to replicate employee master and organizational management data from SAP ERP or SAP S/4HANA to SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central. With this integration scenario you can manage employees and organizational data using ERP as the system of record and either regularly replicate the data to Employee Central when using the Side-by-Side deployment model. Or set up a delta-enabled migration to initially move the data from the ERP system to Employee Central if you want to transition to the Side-by-Side or the Core Hybrid deployment model.

Prerequisite for using this integration scenario: You need to have the PA_SE_IN 100 add-on with SP10 or higher installed in your SAP ERP or SAP S/4HANA system.

Note: You are only allowed to configure the content as described in the guide. If you make modifications not described in the guide, SAP will not provide support for the modified content.
results.ShortText: Replicate employee master and organizational management data from SAP ERP or SAP S/4HANA to SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central
results.Products: [SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, SAP ERP, SAP S/4HANA]

post.description:
You can use the following request to create or upload an integration flow.
For further details, refer to the SAP Help Portal documentation [OData API: Integration Content](https://help.sap.com/viewer/368c481cd6954bdfa5d0435479fd4eaf/Cloud/en-US/d1679a80543f46509a7329243b595bdb.html) and to the following SAP Community blog [Remote OData APIs for Integration Flows](https://blogs.sap.com/2018/07/06/cloud-integration-remote-odata-apis-for-integration-flows/).
In API sandbox, only read APIs can be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to create integration flows.

parameters.name: IntegrationFlow
parameters.description:
New integration flow requires name and package Id.
The name should begin with alphabetic character or underscore ```_``` and can also contain numbers, space, period ```.``` or hyphen ```-```. But it should not end with period ```.```.
The artifact content is only required, if integration flow zip content in base64-encoded format should be uploaded.
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling')
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

400.description: Bad request - wrong name or body is not provided in the expected JSON format.

message.value: Name should begin with alphabet or underscore (_) and can also contain numbers, space, period(.) or hyphen(-). But it should not end with period(.)

404.description: Not found - package Id does not exist.

message.value: Package ID TestPackage123 does not exist.

500.description: Internal server error - possibly an integration flow with the same Id already exists.

message.value: An integration flow Integration Flow with Configuration with the ID IntegrationFlowWithConfiguration already exists in the Cloud Integration API Test Package package. Please rename the artifact ID.

parameters.description:
New attribute values of the Integration Designtime artifact. Check the following table for behavior depending on provided or not provided attributes:
```Name``````ArtifactContent``````Behavior```
YesNoSave as draft
YesYesUpdate & Save by picking bundle version from Bundle Manifest
NoYesUpdate & Save by picking bundle version & bundle Name (iFlow name) from Bundle Manifest

post.description:
You can use the following request to create/upload a message mapping. 
In API sandbox, only read APIs can be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to upload message mappings.

parameters.name: MessageMapping
parameters.description:
New message mapping requires name, Id and package Id.
The name should begin with alphabetic character or underscore ```_``` and can also contain numbers, space, period ```.``` or hyphen ```-```. But it should not end with period ```.```.
The artifact content is only required, if message mapping zip content in base64-encoded format should be uploaded.
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling')
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

400.description: Bad request - wrong name or body is not provided in the expected JSON format.

message.value: Invalid Name is not allowed

404.description: Not found - package Id does not exist.

message.value: Package ID TestPackage123 does not exist.

500.description: Internal server error

message.value: error message

get.description: You can use the following request to get a deployed message mapping deployed by Id and version.
get.summary: Get message mapping by Id and version.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description:
Id of message mapping
Example: ```MessageMapping1```

parameters.name: Version
parameters.description:
Version of message mapping
You can enter either ```active``` or the version name (e.g. ```1.0.5```) for retrieving the current version.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned.

404.description: Not found

message.value: Message Mapping with Id:MessageMapping1 and Version:1.0.40 not found

500.description: Internal server error

put.description:
You can use the following request to update a message mapping.
In API sandbox, only read APIs can be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to update message mappings.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: Id of message mapping

parameters.name: Version
parameters.description:
Current version of message mapping to be updated
You can enter either ```active``` or the current/latest version name (e.g. ```1.0.5```).

parameters.name: MessageMappingDesigntimeArtifact
parameters.description:
New attribute values of message mapping artifact. Check the following table for behavior depending on provided or not provided attributes:
```Name/Description``````ArtifactContent``````Behavior```
YesNoUpdate Name, Description & Save as draft
YesYesUpdate & Save by picking bundle version from Bundle Manifest
NoYesUpdate & Save by picking bundle version, bundle Name and Description from Bundle Manifest
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling')
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

400.description: Update of Message Mapping in a configure only package is not allowed.

message.value: Message Mapping artifact consists in a configure only package with Id: ConfigureOnlyPackageforMessageMapping.

404.description: Integration design time artifact not found.

message.value: Could not find artifact with MessageMapping1.

500.description: Update of Message Mapping failed.

message.value: Update of Message Mapping failed : Update of PackageId and Id are not allowed.

post.description:
You can use the following request to deploy a message mapping.
For further details, refer to the SAP Help Portal documentation [OData API: Integration Content](https://help.sap.com/viewer/368c481cd6954bdfa5d0435479fd4eaf/Cloud/en-US/d1679a80543f46509a7329243b595bdb.html) and to the following SAP Community blog [Remote OData APIs for Integration Flows](https://blogs.sap.com/2018/07/06/cloud-integration-remote-odata-apis-for-integration-flows/).
In API sandbox, only read APIs can be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to deploy message mappings.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: Id of message mapping - enclosed in single quotes

parameters.name: Version
parameters.description:
Version of message mapping - enclosed in single quotes
You can enter either ```'active'``` or the version name (e.g. ```'1.0.5'```) for retrieving the current version.
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling')
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

202.description: Deployment triggered for integration artifact. Response contains task Id.

404.description: Wrong Id - the message mapping does not exist.

message.value: Could not find artifact 'MessageMapping1'.

500.description: Internal server error

message.value: <error text>

get.description: You can use the following request to get the [Build and Deploy Status](https://help.sap.com/viewer/368c481cd6954bdfa5d0435479fd4eaf/Cloud/en-US/d8934e0d3ab649ecb5ae744663c7962c.html) of an artifact by task Id. For an example scenario that shows you how to use this request in a sequence with other API calls, refer to the SAP Help Portal documentation [Get Runtime Status of Deployed Integration Flow](https://help.sap.com/viewer/368c481cd6954bdfa5d0435479fd4eaf/Cloud/en-US/49c733687c80415aa5b67d58cda99dbf.html).

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: Task Id of design time artifact

message.value: You have specified an incorrect URI or the TaskId is empty.

message.value: Cannot get build and deploy status for artifact with TaskId 'abcd-1234-xyz'.

get.description:
You can use the following request to get the configuration parameters (key/value pairs) of an integration artifact by Id and version.
For further details, refer to the SAP Help Portal documentation [OData API: Integration Content](https://help.sap.com/viewer/368c481cd6954bdfa5d0435479fd4eaf/Cloud/en-US/d1679a80543f46509a7329243b595bdb.html) and to the following SAP Community blog [Remote OData APIs for Integration Flows](https://blogs.sap.com/2018/07/06/cloud-integration-remote-odata-apis-for-integration-flows/).
In API sandbox, the following integration flow contains configuration parameters: '__IntegrationFlowWithConfiguration__' with version '__1.0.5__'
get.summary: Get configurations of an integration flow by Id and version.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description:
Id of integration artifact
Example: ```IntegrationFlowWithConfiguration```

parameters.name: Version
parameters.description:
Version of integration artifact
You can enter either ```active``` or the version name (e.g. ```1.0.5```) for retrieving the current version.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
Returns a subset of the entries, which matches the filter condition.
Supported operators: ```eq``` and ```ne```
Supported string functions: ```substringof```, ```startswith``` and ```endswith```.
Example: ```substringof('Receiver_',ParameterKey) eq true```

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values.

parameters.name: $format
parameters.description: Response format can be JSON or XML.

get.description:
You can use the following request to get all deployed integration artifacts.
In API sandbox the following integration flows are deployed:
* '__Integration Flow - FAILED DEPLOYMENT__' with deployment error information * '__Integration Flow with MessageStore - COMPLETED PROCESSING__' with attachments and message store entries * '__Integration Flow with Adapter Data - FAILED PROCESSING__' with message processing log error information, attachments, custom header properties and adapater data
get.summary: Get all deployed integration artifacts.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
Filter items by property values (not possible for DeployedOn). No nesting possible. Only logical operator ```or``` is allowed.
Example1: ```Status eq 'ERROR'``` returns all deployed integration artifacts in status 'ERROR'.
Example2: ```Status eq 'ERROR' or Version eq '1.0.0'```

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values, see [Orderby System Query Option](https://www.odata.org/documentation/odata-version-2-0/uri-conventions/)

results.Name: Integration Flow with MessageStore - COMPLETED PROCESSING

parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

You can use the following request to get all endpoints provided for deployed integration flows.

get.summary: Get endpoints of integration flows.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
Returns a subset of the entries, which matches the filter condition.
Example: ```Name eq 'IntegrationFlowWithConfiguration'``` provides all endpoints of the deployed integration flow with the ID IntegrationFlowWithConfiguration.
Example: ```Protocol eq 'SOAP'``` provides all endpoints of the deployed integration flows with SOAP protocol type.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Expand related entities.

parameters.name: $format
parameters.description: Response format can be JSON or XML.

delete.description:
You can use the following request to delete a resource of a script collection.
For further details, refer to the SAP Help Portal documentation [OData API: Integration Content](https://help.sap.com/viewer/368c481cd6954bdfa5d0435479fd4eaf/Cloud/en-US/d1679a80543f46509a7329243b595bdb.html).
In API sandbox, only read APIs can be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to update integration flows.
delete.summary: Delete a resource of a script collection.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description:
Id of script collection artifact
Example: **ScriptCollection1**

parameters.name: Version
parameters.description:
Version of script collection artifact
You can enter either **active** or the version name (e.g. *1.0.5**) for retrieving the current version.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description:
Resource name
Example: ```AddSignatureInfo.xsl```

parameters.name: Type
parameters.description:
Resource type
Example: ```xslt```

parameters.name: ReferencedResourceType
parameters.description: Reference to another resource type (only for resource type 'xsd' the reference to 'wsdl' is allowed).
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling')
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

post.description:
You can use the following request to deploy a script collection.
For further details, refer to the SAP Help Portal documentation [OData API: Integration Content](https://help.sap.com/viewer/368c481cd6954bdfa5d0435479fd4eaf/Cloud/en-US/d1679a80543f46509a7329243b595bdb.html).
In API sandbox, only read APIs can be tested. You need to configure an API endpoint for your account, where you have the required write permissions to deploy script collections.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description:
Id of script collection - enclosed in single quotes
Example: **ScriptCollection1**

parameters.name: Version
parameters.description:
Version of script collection artifact - enclosed in single quotes
You can enter either **active** or the version name (e.g. **1.0.5**) for retrieving the current version.
CSRF token that is valid for the current session (see resource 'CSRF Token Handling')
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

202.description: Deployment triggered for script collection artifact. Response contains task Id.

400.description: Bad request - wrong Id or version or single quotes are missing.

message.value: No content for id 'ScriptCollection1'.

500.description: Internal server error

message.value: <error text>

get.description:
You can use the following request to get the CSRF token for this session, which is required for write access via POST, PUT and DELETE operations. Copy the received X-CSRF-Token from the response header.
**In API sandbox this request is not relevant!**
get.summary: Get CSRF token.

parameters.description: To retrieve a new CSRF token the value of the header must be set to ```Fetch```.
parameters.name: X-CSRF-Token

200.description: The header provides the CSRF token for this session.

X-CSRF-Token.description: CSRF token that can be used for all modifying requests within the same session.
